ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Incredible opportunity for hands-on, practical instruction in key lab techniques. The student-to-teacher ratio was ideal and Dr. Whirledge does an incredible job of creating an environment in which the student can learn on an individual and team level.
lab techniques
Introductory laboratory techniques used in biology of reproduction research such as qPCR, western blotting, and immunohistochenistry.
laboratory techniques for reproductive biology research.
how to use lab techniques to analyze reproductive system related experimentshypotheses
I learned laboratory techniques and applied investigation learned in lecture
Practical lab skills, reading.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: fun labs, very nice professors

Strengths: very well structured course, the instructors create a non-stressful and very supportive learning environment, the content was rigorous and very applicable to any research in the biological and biomedical field 

Weakness: sometimes the weekly readings were a bit challenging to understand. However as the course progresses you get better at reading scientific literature.

This was my favorite lab I have taken at Yale! I looked forward to coming into lab each week and always learned something new. The workload was manageable, and the professors and TF were extremely helpful. I can't think of any weaknesses.
strength - interesting content! relevant

The strength is the amount of learning that happens in class and the respect instructors have for students time. The homework is reasonable and the class exists such that students are required to be engaged and present but not conduct hours of busy work. The instructors could spend more time in class asking students to work through practice problems since students have different levels of email Iwrits with statistical analysis.
Great work balance while still learning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely recommend this course. This course is a must if you're interested in reproductive biology, learning lab techniques, and truly engaging in the learning process with a dedicated professor.
Very fun lab to finish off MCDB! Strongly recommend. Professor Whirledge is such a joy!

Yes! Please take this class. Its very fun, challenging in a GOOD way, and teaches you so much. I wish all Yale courses were structured like this. The professors should definitely earn teaching awards for how great they are :) Dr. Whirledge is a wonderful instructor was super organized all along
Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course to other students! This lab was enjoyable, very interesting, and the workload was not overwhelming.
yes! if you can get into it, take it

If youre pre med and need an extra lab, this is a great option! I also really enjoyed the lecture course and this was essentially applying practical skills to those concepts. Workload is also very light relative to other labs but still doesnt feel like busy work.
Absolutely. Best lab course Ive taken at Yale.
Yes, learn with good balance.
